result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Jay Bearhart

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 21, 2023 at 09:00 am.

3:17 PM Cases 22CF63, 2022CF000105, 2022CF000174, 2022TR000163, 2022TR000164, and 2022TR000165 called together.  Defendant Ronald Jay Bearhart in court.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Ronald Jay Bearhart.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF105 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Cliff Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Nero crosses.  State redirects.  Atty Nero re-crosses.  Witness steps down.  State calls second witness, deputy Jared Woody, who is sworn in and testifies.  Atty Nero crosses.  State calls third witness, deputy Bailey Mangen, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Atty Nero crosses.  State redirects.  Witness steps down.  No further witnesses.  State argues for bind-over.  State notes he forgot to enter prior OWI record into evidence.  Court states evidence is reopened.  State asks Court to take judicial notice of def's OWI convictions.  Atty Nero makes an objection for the record.  Court takes judicial notice of the JOC in Burnett County case 19CF257.  Atty Nero argues against bind-over, moves to dismiss.  Court will require written briefs on this matter.  Atty Nero requests 30 days from the filing of transcript.  Court reporter has 90 days to file transcript.  Atty Nero has until 2/27/23 to file brief.  ADA Schmidt requests a little more than 2 weeks.  ADA Schmidt has until 3/27/23 to file his response.  Off the record 4:00 PM.  Back on the record 4:01 PM, same appearances.  Case 22CF174 is on for waiver of preliminary hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Memo from DA's office to Request New Date
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:09 PM Cases 22CF63, 2022CF000105, 2022TR000163, 2022TR000164, 2022TR000165, and 22CF174 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald Jay Bearhart in court.  Attorney Adam P Nero in court for Ronald Jay Bearhart.  Cases 22CF105 and 22CF174 on for initial appearances.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Atty Nero wishes to argue bond.  State does not object to hearing bond argument.  Atty Nero argues to reduce cash bond to $2500 and release the excess to the bond poster.  ADA Schmidt responds- not objecting to bond reduction.  Court reduces cash bond to $4k.  Excess bond to be returned to the bail bond poster.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.  No driving without a valid driver's license.

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CF63, 22CF105, and 22CF174.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Letter RE: jury trials in the tracking TRs
Letter to Judge Mogen Request to reschedule
